title: Phase 1: Foundation - Hugo setup, theme skeleton, base templates
description: Set up the Hugo project, create custom theme skeleton, configure hugo.toml, build base HTML templates with dark theme CSS, navigation and footer. Deliverable: blank site that builds and serves locally with dark theme, navigation, footer, and all base templates rendering correctly.

title: Initialize Hugo site with hugo new site
description: Run hugo new site . --force to scaffold the Hugo project in the existing directory. Verify the directory structure is created (archetypes/, content/, layouts/, static/, themes/, hugo.toml). Acceptance: hugo version runs and project structure exists.

title: Create default single.html and list.html templates
description: Create themes/foz/layouts/_default/single.html: extends baseof.html, renders .Title as h1, renders .Content as main content, wraps in container div. Create themes/foz/layouts/_default/list.html: extends baseof.html, renders .Title as h1, loops .Pages to list child pages with links, wraps in container div. These are fallback templates for any content type without a specific layout. Acceptance: generic content pages render with title and body text.

title: Create content/_index.md placeholder and verify site builds
description: Create content/_index.md with minimal frontmatter (title: Foundry of Zero). Run hugo server and verify: site builds without errors, page loads at localhost:1313, dark theme renders with correct colors, nav and footer appear with all elements, fonts load correctly. This is the integration test for Phase 1. Acceptance: hugo builds clean with zero errors, site serves and renders the complete base layout.

title: Create .gitignore for Hugo project
description: Create .gitignore with entries for: public/ (Hugo build output), resources/_gen/ (Hugo generated resources), .hugo_build.lock, .DS_Store, node_modules/ (if ever needed). Acceptance: git status does not show generated or build files after running hugo.

title: Create hugo.toml with site config
description: Configure hugo.toml with: baseURL=https://foundryofzero.ai/, title=Foundry of Zero, theme=foz, taxonomy config for tags, menu config for nav (Projects, Blog, About), params section (tagline, github URL, description), markup config for syntax highlighting (monokai or dracula), output formats (HTML, RSS). Acceptance: hugo.toml is valid and hugo can parse it without errors.

title: Create custom theme directory structure themes/foz
description: Create the full theme directory tree: themes/foz/layouts/_default/ (baseof.html, single.html, list.html), themes/foz/layouts/partials/ (head.html, nav.html, footer.html), themes/foz/layouts/projects/ (single.html), themes/foz/layouts/blog/ (single.html, list.html), themes/foz/layouts/taxonomy/ (list.html, term.html), themes/foz/layouts/index.html, themes/foz/static/css/ js/ images/, themes/foz/archetypes/. Acceptance: directory tree exists, theme.toml present in themes/foz/.

title: Build baseof.html base template
description: Create themes/foz/layouts/_default/baseof.html with HTML5 doctype, lang=en, partial head.html in head, partial nav.html at top of body, block main for page content, partial footer.html at bottom, link to main.css. This is the master layout all pages inherit from. Acceptance: base template renders valid HTML structure with head, nav, content block, and footer.

title: Build head.html partial with meta, fonts, CSS links
description: Create themes/foz/layouts/partials/head.html with charset and viewport meta tags, page title using .Title | .Site.Title, meta description, Google Fonts links for JetBrains Mono and Inter, link to main.css stylesheet, favicon link. Acceptance: fonts load correctly, meta tags render correctly in HTML source.

title: Build nav.html partial for desktop and mobile
description: Create themes/foz/layouts/partials/nav.html with fixed/sticky nav bar at top, FoZ logo/wordmark on left (text-based initially), nav links on right (Projects, Blog, About), GitHub icon link (external, new tab), hamburger menu button for mobile (hidden on desktop), mobile menu overlay (hidden by default, toggled by JS), active state for current page. Acceptance: nav renders horizontal links on desktop, hamburger appears on mobile widths.

title: Build footer.html partial
description: Create themes/foz/layouts/partials/footer.html with copyright line (2026 Foundry of Zero), GitHub profile link, tagline 'Build what isn't.', and 'Built with Hugo' credit in small muted text. Acceptance: footer renders at bottom of every page with all elements.

title: Create main.css with CSS custom properties and dark theme
description: Create themes/foz/static/css/main.css with CSS custom properties for full color palette (--bg-deep:#0a0a0a, --bg-surface:#111111, --bg-elevated:#1a1a1a, --text-primary:#e0e0e0, --text-muted:#666666, --accent-matrix:#00ff41, --accent-copper:#b87333, --accent-amber:#d4a853), CSS reset/normalize, base typography (body=Inter/system sans, headings=JetBrains Mono), dark background on body with light text, link styles (matrix green default, copper on hover), container class with max-width and padding, nav styles (sticky, dark surface bg, flex layout), footer styles, utility classes. Acceptance: dark theme renders correctly, typography hierarchy clear, colors match spec.

title: Create nav.js for mobile hamburger menu toggle
description: Create themes/foz/static/js/nav.js with vanilla JS (no dependencies): event listener on hamburger button, toggle a CSS class on the mobile menu element to show/hide it, close menu when a nav link is clicked, close menu when clicking outside the menu. Acceptance: hamburger toggles mobile menu open/close, menu closes on link click and outside click.

title: Phase 5: About page and custom 404
description: Build the About page with NiXLiM/FoZ information, the 0-to-1 philosophy, vibe engineering explanation, and placeholder for steampunk goblin illustration. Build a custom 404 error page with Matrix/steampunk aesthetic. Deliverable: all content pages complete.

title: Create about page template and content
description: Create content/about/index.md with frontmatter title='About' and SEO description. Body content: who NiXLiM is (kept brief and slightly mysterious), what Foundry of Zero is as a brand, the philosophy of building genuinely new things rather than copying or incrementally improving (0-to-1 creation), what 'vibe engineering' means in practice (building with AI agents, vibes-first approach to software development), link to GitHub profile (github.com/nixlim). Include a placeholder image tag for the steampunk goblin 'Inventor' illustration (image to be generated separately). Template: uses _default/single.html or create custom about layout if additional styling needed. Acceptance: /about/ renders with informative, well-structured content and visible placeholder for illustration.

title: Create custom 404 page
description: Create themes/foz/layouts/404.html extending baseof.html: large '404' display in monospace JetBrains Mono font colored matrix green (#00ff41), message text 'Lost in the machine.' below in muted text, placeholder for the steampunk goblin 'Lost in the Machine' illustration, prominent link back to home styled as CTA: 'Return to the Foundry' linking to /. CSS: centered layout (flexbox), large 404 text size (clamp for responsive), consistent spacing. Page should feel atmospheric, not generic. Acceptance: navigating to any non-existent URL renders the styled 404 page with all elements.

title: Phase 4: Blog - listing, post template, tags, syntax highlighting, sample post
description: Build blog listing page with tag filters, individual post template with prose styling and syntax highlighting, tag taxonomy pages for filtering by tag, configure syntax highlighting for code blocks, create archetypes for easy post creation, and write a sample 'Hello World' blog post. Verify RSS feed generation. Deliverable: /blog/ section fully working with sample content.

title: Create blog list.html template
description: Create themes/foz/layouts/blog/list.html extending baseof.html: page title 'Blog', tag filter links at top listing all tags used across blog posts as clickable pills, reverse-chronological list of post cards rendered using post-card partial, handle empty state gracefully with a 'No posts yet. Check back soon.' message when no blog content exists. CSS: tag filter row styles (horizontal scrollable on mobile), post list layout with consistent spacing. Acceptance: /blog/ renders post list with tag filters, empty state handled.

title: Create blog single.html post template
description: Create themes/foz/layouts/blog/single.html extending baseof.html: post title as h1, meta row with formatted date, reading time (.ReadingTime min read), and tags as links to /tags/<tag>/, full markdown content with prose styling (.Content), syntax highlighted code blocks using Hugo built-in Chroma, back link 'Back to Blog' linking to /blog/. CSS: prose/article styles with wider line-height (1.7), comfortable max reading width (~70ch), code block styling (dark bg with matrix green accents), inline code styling (bg-elevated background with copper text), blockquote styling. Acceptance: blog post renders with all metadata, readable typography, and syntax-highlighted code blocks.

title: Configure syntax highlighting in hugo.toml
description: Add syntax highlighting config to hugo.toml under [markup.highlight]: style='monokai' (dark theme compatible), lineNos=false, guessSyntax=true, tabWidth=4. Verify rendering with a fenced code block in the sample blog post using Go and JavaScript language hints. Acceptance: fenced code blocks render with proper syntax highlighting in dark colors that match the site theme.

title: Create tag taxonomy templates list and term
description: Create themes/foz/layouts/taxonomy/list.html: shows all tags as a list or cloud with post counts next to each tag, each tag links to /tags/<tag>/. Create themes/foz/layouts/taxonomy/term.html: shows tag name as page heading, lists all posts with that tag using post-card partial in reverse chronological order, includes back link to /tags/. CSS: tag cloud/list styles with copper-colored tags, post count in muted text. Acceptance: /tags/ shows all tags with counts, /tags/<tag>/ shows correctly filtered posts.

title: Create blog.md archetype
description: Create archetypes/blog.md with frontmatter template: title (from filename), date (auto-populated), draft=true, tags=[] (empty array), description (empty string placeholder). Body contains placeholder text reminding author to set draft=false when ready to publish. Enables 'hugo new blog/my-post.md' to scaffold a new blog post with all required fields. Acceptance: 'hugo new blog/test.md' creates a file with correct frontmatter including draft=true default.

title: Create content/blog/_index.md
description: Create content/blog/_index.md with frontmatter: title='Blog', description='Thoughts on vibe engineering, AI-assisted development, and building from zero' for SEO meta description. No body text needed (the listing template handles layout). Acceptance: /blog/ page has correct title and meta description.

title: Create sample blog post hello-world.md
description: Create content/blog/hello-world.md with frontmatter: title='Hello, World', date=2026-01-31, draft=false, tags=[meta, vibe-engineering], description='First post from the Foundry.' Body: 3-4 paragraphs introducing what Foundry of Zero is, what vibe engineering means (building with AI agents, vibes-first approach to development), and what to expect from the blog. Include at least one fenced code block (Go or JS) to test syntax highlighting rendering. Acceptance: post renders at /blog/hello-world/ with readable content, appears in blog listing and on homepage latest posts section.

title: Verify RSS feed for blog
description: Verify that Hugo generates a valid RSS feed at /blog/index.xml. Check hugo.toml output formats config includes RSS for the blog section. Ensure the feed contains: post title, publication date, description/summary, link to full post, and full content. Test by loading the XML in a browser or RSS validator. Acceptance: /blog/index.xml returns valid RSS XML containing all published blog posts with complete metadata.

title: Phase 6: Polish, mobile responsiveness, SEO, and deployment
description: Final polish pass: comprehensive mobile responsiveness testing and fixes across all breakpoints, OpenGraph and Twitter Card meta tags for social sharing, robots.txt and sitemap.xml verification, CNAME file for foundryofzero.ai custom domain, GitHub Actions CI/CD workflow for automated Hugo build and deploy to GitHub Pages, SVG favicon, and final build verification with cleanup. Deliverable: production-ready site deployed to GitHub Pages at foundryofzero.ai.

title: Mobile responsiveness pass on all pages
description: Comprehensive review and fix of responsive layout across all pages and breakpoints. Check: hero section stacks vertically with full-width CTAs on mobile, project grid collapses 3-col to 2-col (768px) to 1-col (480px), nav hamburger menu works correctly on all mobile sizes, blog post prose does not overflow horizontally, footer stacks elements on small screens, all cards have appropriate padding on mobile, all touch targets minimum 44px, no horizontal scroll on any page. Test at breakpoints: 320px, 375px, 768px, 1024px, 1440px. Acceptance: site is usable and visually attractive at all common breakpoints with no layout breaks.

title: Add OpenGraph and Twitter Card meta tags
description: Update themes/foz/layouts/partials/head.html to include OpenGraph and Twitter Card meta tags: og:title, og:description, og:url, og:type (website for pages, article for posts), og:image, twitter:card (summary_large_image), twitter:title, twitter:description, twitter:image. Use page-specific values (.Title, .Description, .Permalink) where available, fall back to site-level defaults from hugo.toml params. Create a static/images/og-default.png placeholder image (1200x630) for social sharing cards. Acceptance: sharing any page URL on social media shows correct title, description, and image in link preview.

title: Add robots.txt and verify sitemap.xml
description: Verify Hugo generates sitemap.xml automatically at /sitemap.xml with all published pages. Create static/robots.txt with: User-agent: * Allow: / Sitemap: https://foundryofzero.ai/sitemap.xml. Verify both files are accessible after build and contain correct content. Acceptance: /robots.txt allows all crawlers and references sitemap, /sitemap.xml lists all published pages with correct URLs.

title: Create CNAME file for custom domain
description: Create static/CNAME file containing exactly: foundryofzero.ai (no trailing newline or whitespace). This file gets copied to public/ during Hugo build and tells GitHub Pages to serve the site on the custom domain. Acceptance: CNAME file exists in static/ with correct domain value, appears in public/ after hugo build.

title: Create GitHub Actions deployment workflow
description: Create .github/workflows/deploy.yml GitHub Actions workflow: trigger on push to main branch, job steps: checkout repo (actions/checkout@v4), install Hugo (peaceiris/actions-hugo@v3 with hugo-version=latest), run 'hugo --minify' to build, deploy to gh-pages branch (peaceiris/actions-gh-pages@v4 with github_token, publish_dir=./public, cname=foundryofzero.ai). Set permissions: contents: write. Acceptance: workflow YAML is valid, would build Hugo site and deploy to gh-pages branch on push to main.

title: Create project .gitignore
description: Ensure .gitignore contains all necessary entries: public/ (Hugo build output), resources/_gen/ (Hugo generated resources), .hugo_build.lock, .DS_Store, Thumbs.db, node_modules/, beads-batch.md (temp planning file). Verify no build artifacts or OS files are tracked by git. Acceptance: git status shows clean after hugo build, no generated files tracked.

title: Add favicon placeholder SVG
description: Create a simple SVG favicon as static/favicon.svg: a gear/cog shape with the number '0' centered inside it, colored matrix green (#00ff41) on transparent background, suitable for display at 32x32 and 16x16 pixel sizes. Update themes/foz/layouts/partials/head.html to reference the favicon with: link rel=icon type=image/svg+xml href=/favicon.svg. Acceptance: browser tab shows the green gear-zero favicon when loading any page.

title: Final build verification and cleanup
description: Run 'hugo --minify' and verify: build completes with zero errors and zero warnings, all pages render correctly (home, projects listing, 3 project details, blog listing, blog post, about, 404, tags), all internal links work with no broken links, RSS feed at /blog/index.xml is valid XML, static assets (CSS, JS, images, favicon) are served correctly, CNAME file present in public/. Clean up temp files (beads-batch.md, any test content). Final git commit with clean state. Acceptance: clean build with zero issues, all pages functional and visually correct, repository ready for deployment.

title: Phase 3: Projects - listing page, detail template, project content
description: Build project listing page with responsive grid, project detail page template with metadata display, and create content files for all 3 initial projects (Hive, Academic Quote Extractor, OpenCode Beads Plugin). Also create a projects archetype so new projects can be added by dropping a single markdown file. Deliverable: /projects/ section fully working with all project pages populated.

title: Create projects list.html template
description: Create themes/foz/layouts/projects/list.html extending baseof.html: page title 'Projects', brief intro text pulled from content/projects/_index.md body, grid of all project cards rendered using project-card partial, sorted by weight (frontmatter) then date, responsive CSS grid (3-col desktop, 2-col tablet at 768px, 1-col mobile at 480px). Acceptance: /projects/ page renders all projects in a responsive grid with intro text above.

title: Create projects single.html detail template
description: Create themes/foz/layouts/projects/single.html extending baseof.html: project title as h1, status badge next to title (colored per status: green=active, amber=experimental, muted=archived), tech stack tags row as copper-colored pills, GitHub repo link as prominent button/link (opens new tab, styled with matrix green), full markdown content body from .Content, back link 'Back to Projects' linking to /projects/, optional project image if .Params.image is set. CSS: detail page layout, GitHub button styles, back link styles. Acceptance: individual project page renders with all metadata fields and content.

title: Create content/projects/_index.md
description: Create content/projects/_index.md with title: 'Projects', SEO description, and body text: a short paragraph about FoZ projects -- tools forged from scratch, open source, built with AI-assisted development. This intro text appears above the project grid on the listing page. Acceptance: /projects/ page shows intro text above the project card grid.

title: Create project content: Hive
description: Create content/projects/hive.md with frontmatter: title='Hive', description='Multi-agent orchestration for software development', status='experimental', github='https://github.com/nixlim/hive', tech=[Go, Claude Code, Git], featured=true, weight=1. Body: 2-3 paragraphs describing what Hive does (coordinates multiple Claude Code agents through roles like architect, engineer, reviewer), how it works (supervisor process, agent pool, git worktree isolation per task, bead-based issue tracking), and its current experimental status. Content based on the actual repo README. Acceptance: Hive project page renders at /projects/hive/ with accurate description.

title: Create project content: Academic Quote Extractor
description: Create content/projects/academic-quote-extractor.md with frontmatter: title='Academic Quote Extractor', description='CLI for extracting quotes from academic documents with Harvard citations', status='experimental', github='https://github.com/nixlim/academic-quote-extractor', tech=[Go, Docker, Claude, Weaviate, SQLite], featured=true, weight=2. Body: 2-3 paragraphs describing AQE's hybrid RAG architecture (ingest/extract/export pipeline), its zero-hallucination guarantee (LLM only scores, quotes always retrieved verbatim from SQLite), and the tech stack (Docling for parsing, Weaviate for hybrid search, Ollama for embeddings, Claude for scoring). Content based on actual repo README. Acceptance: AQE project page renders at /projects/academic-quote-extractor/ with accurate description.

title: Create project content: OpenCode Beads Plugin
description: Create content/projects/opencode-beads-plugin.md with frontmatter: title='OpenCode Beads Plugin', description='Integrates Beads issue tracking with OpenCode', status='active', github='https://github.com/nixlim/opencode_beads_plugin', tech=[JavaScript, OpenCode SDK], featured=true, weight=3. Body: 2-3 paragraphs describing the plugin's event-driven architecture (session.created priming, session.compacting context injection, session.idle sync), how it bridges the bd CLI with OpenCode's plugin system, and customization options. Content based on actual repo README. Acceptance: plugin project page renders at /projects/opencode-beads-plugin/ with accurate description.

title: Create projects.md archetype for easy project addition
description: Create archetypes/projects.md with full frontmatter template including all project fields: title, description, date, status (active/experimental/archived), github URL, tech array, featured boolean, weight integer, optional image path. Body contains placeholder text with instructions explaining each field. This enables 'hugo new projects/my-new-project.md' to scaffold a new project with all required fields. Acceptance: running 'hugo new projects/test.md' creates a file with correct complete frontmatter template.

title: Create project content: Task Templating
description: Create content/projects/task-templating.md with frontmatter: title='Task Templating', description='Structured task specification format and validator for AI coding agents', status='experimental', github='https://github.com/nixlim/task_templating', tech=[Go, JSON Schema], featured=true, weight=4. Body: 2-3 paragraphs covering: (1) The problem -- natural language task descriptions are ambiguous, AI agents fill gaps with assumptions that diverge from intent, causing rework and defects. (2) The solution -- a machine-readable structured task format (STRUCTURED_TEMPLATE_SPEC.md) with required fields (TASK_ID, TASK_NAME, GOAL, INPUTS, OUTPUTS, ACCEPTANCE) and contextual fields (DEPENDS_ON, CONSTRAINTS, FILES_SCOPE) that force completeness and eliminate ambiguity. (3) The taskval CLI -- a Go validator implementing two-tier validation: Tier 1 uses JSON Schema Draft 2020-12 for structural checks (required fields, types, patterns, enums), Tier 2 runs semantic checks (DAG cycle detection via Kahn's algorithm, dangling dependency references, goal quality analysis rejecting vague words like 'try'/'explore', acceptance criterion vagueness detection). Errors are structured and machine-readable, enabling an LLM self-correction feedback loop. (4) Mention the lambda-LLM analysis as a companion research document exploring formal verification with refinement types and SMT solvers as a supplementary approach for critical algorithmic functions. Minimal dependencies (single external dep: kaptinlin/jsonschema). Acceptance: Task Templating project page renders at /projects/task-templating/ with accurate description matching the actual README.

title: Phase 2: Home Page - hero, matrix rain, featured projects, latest posts
description: Build the home page with hero section (brand identity + tagline), Matrix rain canvas effect behind the hero, featured projects grid pulling from project content, and latest blog posts section. Deliverable: fully styled, visually striking landing page with all sections functional.

title: Create index.html home page template
description: Create themes/foz/layouts/index.html that extends baseof.html with three main blocks: hero section, projects section, and blog section. Each section wrapped in semantic HTML section elements with IDs (hero, projects, latest). Template structure only -- content and styling handled in subsequent tasks. Acceptance: home page renders with three distinct, identifiable sections.

title: Build hero section with brand identity and tagline
description: Build the hero section in index.html with: full-width dark section with subtle background, 'Foundry of Zero' as large heading in JetBrains Mono, 'Build what isn't.' as subheading with terminal-style cursor blink CSS animation, two CTA buttons ('View Projects' linking to /projects/ and 'Read the Blog' linking to /blog/) styled as matrix green outline buttons, generous vertical padding (min 60vh). CSS: hero section styles, CTA button styles, cursor blink keyframe animation, tagline typography. Acceptance: hero is visually striking, CTAs work and link correctly, cursor blink animation runs.

title: Implement Matrix rain canvas effect
description: Create themes/foz/static/js/matrix.js with HTML5 canvas-based Matrix-style falling green characters (katakana + digits). Must be: low opacity (0.03-0.05) so subtle and not distracting, respect prefers-reduced-motion media query (pause animation), responsive (resize with window), performant (requestAnimationFrame throttled to ~20fps max). Create themes/foz/layouts/partials/matrix-rain.html partial to include the canvas element and script tag. CSS: position canvas absolutely behind hero content with pointer-events:none and z-index below content. Acceptance: rain animates behind hero section, is subtle, pauses for reduced-motion preference, no performance jank.

title: Build project-card.html partial
description: Create themes/foz/layouts/partials/project-card.html component: card with dark elevated background (--bg-elevated), project title as h3, one-line description from frontmatter, tech tags displayed as small copper-colored (#b87333) pill badges, status badge (green for active, amber for experimental, muted for archived), GitHub icon link, entire card clickable linking to project detail page, subtle hover effect (border glow in matrix green or slight translateY lift with transition). CSS: card container styles, pill/badge styles, status badge color variants, hover transition (0.2s ease). Acceptance: card renders all fields from project frontmatter, hover effect works, links to correct detail page.

title: Build featured projects section on home page
description: Add projects section to index.html: section heading '// PROJECTS' in terminal-style monospace, 3-column CSS grid of project cards (2-col at 768px tablet breakpoint, 1-col at 480px mobile), filter content to only featured projects using Hugo where function on Params.featured=true, sort by weight then date, 'View all projects' link below the grid linking to /projects/. CSS: grid layout with gap, responsive breakpoints, terminal-style section heading (monospace font, muted prefix). Acceptance: featured projects render in responsive grid, link to /projects/ works.

title: Build post-card.html partial
description: Create themes/foz/layouts/partials/post-card.html component: date displayed in formatted muted text, post title as h3 linking to the post, excerpt/description from frontmatter .Description or .Summary, tags as small pill badges, reading time (.ReadingTime min read) in muted text, subtle hover effect matching project card style. CSS: post card styles, date formatting, tag pills in copper color, reading time display. Acceptance: post card renders all fields, links to full post, hover effect works consistently with project cards.

title: Build latest blog posts section on home page
description: Add blog section to index.html: section heading '// LATEST' in terminal-style monospace, show 3 most recent blog posts using Hugo first/where functions filtering by Section=blog, render each using post-card partial, 'View all posts' link below linking to /blog/, handle empty state gracefully (show message like 'No posts yet. Check back soon.' when no blog content exists). CSS: section layout matching projects section spacing. Acceptance: latest posts render when content exists, empty state message shows when no posts, link to /blog/ works.
